result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:20 AM Defendant Daniel Lee Bernard in court.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Daniel Lee Bernard.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
Defense requests another status date for defendant to complete treatment. 
State indicates she had an offer on the file that and will be asking for COP or trial at the next date. 
Defense indicates they do not plan to go to trial. 
BTC: Matter set over.

BTC: Matter set over.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim C.E.B and mother. (person, property, residence or family). Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 4/29/2022 to no violent contact with C.E.B. Defendant may have contact with children as long as it is supervised.

8:44 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel Lee Bernard in court.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Daniel Lee Bernard. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. Alleged victim present in court. 
Matter set to address Defense's to modify no contact.
Defense gives further status as to request as outlined in motion. 
State indicates they haven't had contact with the alleged victim since the initial appearance, requests she make a statement and also indicates she objects to modification. 
Court asks alleged victim to speak in regards to motion. Some form of identification made with her. 
BTC: BOND MOTION: Granted, no violent contact. Contact with children needs to be supervised at all times.

Status conference on July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
